title: Identify residual from scatterplot of fiber wool

content.description:
Data were collected on the fiber diameter and the fleece weight of wool taken from a sample of <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> sheep. The data are shown in the following graphs. Graph <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is a scatterplot of fleece weight versus fiber diameter with the respective least-squares regression line shown. Graph <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is the associated plot of the residuals versus the predicted values.

One point is circled on graph <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. Five points labeled A, B, C, D, and E are identified on graph <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which point on graph <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> represents the residual for the circled point on graph <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct numerical or graphical representations of distributions.
